segments.text: What shall we do when we find a shortage in the shipment ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: You should do one of the two things - either to lodge a claim with the shipowner or with the insurance company .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Shall we leave it to the brokers ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Of course . In Europe , they charge a commission of 1 % of the amount of the claim for their service .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Is it the same in America ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: They do the work without charge to the importer .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It's part of their service , isn't it ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Is it enough to claim with an on board bill of lading ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No , you must also obtain a statement from the shipping agent certifying that the goods were actually loaded on their vessel for shipment .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I see . By the way , how do we prove the ownership of our goods ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: You must provide full original set of ocean bills of lading original insurance policy or certificate and the original commercia invoice .
segments.speaker: S2
